summary_points.title: Muted Opening Anticipated
summary_points.summary: Indian benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty 50 are expected to start flat on Thursday, as Gift Nifty trades marginally above Nifty futures and global market cues remain mixed, pointing to a cautious opening.

summary_points.title: Benchmarks Extend Winning Streak
summary_points.summary: Equity markets logged a fifth consecutive session of gains, with the Sensex climbing over 213 points to 81,857.84 and the Nifty 50 topping the 25,000 mark, closing at 25,050.55 on sustained bullish sentiment.

summary_points.title: IT and Pharma Drive Gains, FMCG Sees Profit Booking
summary_points.summary: Sectoral trends saw strong performances in IT and pharma stocks lifting the Nifty above 25,100, while FMCG names witnessed profit-taking after recent rallies, reflecting varied investor focus across segments.

summary_points.title: Global Cues Mixed After Fed Minutes
summary_points.summary: Asian markets traded unevenly and US equities slipped following the release of Fed meeting minutes, leading Indian markets to monitor overseas developments closely for guidance on interest rates and liquidity.

summary_points.title: Domestic Institutional Buying Cushions Market
summary_points.summary: Robust inflows from domestic institutions countered heavy foreign institutional investor selling, helping sustain market momentum and underpinning the recent rally in key indices.

summary_points.title: Key Stock Movers: Infosys, TCS Lead; Select Names Lag
summary_points.summary: Among Sensex components, Infosys and TCS powered ahead with gains near 3–4%, while counters like Bharat Electronics and Bajaj Finance underperformed, highlighting divergent stock-specific flows.

articles.snippet: Indian stock market today see indices rallying as Nifty 50 holds above 25,100 with IT sector leadership.

top_performing_sectors.explanation: The Nifty IT index rose 0.34% to 35,811.05, led by gains in TCS and Infosys, making IT the primary driver of today’s rally.
The Nifty Bank index climbed 0.24% to 55,833.95, with Bajaj Finance and Bajaj Finserv each gaining over 1%, reflecting renewed investor interest in the banking space.
Pharma stocks contributed strongly, with Dr. Reddy’s Laboratories jumping 2.28% to lead the Nifty 50 gainers.

underperforming_sectors.explanation: After a three-day rally on GST reform hopes, FMCG names like Dabur India and Tata Consumer faced profit booking and fell over 1%.

market_drivers.summary: Today’s market advance was underpinned by a broad sectoral rally led by IT heavyweights TCS and Infosys and pharma outperformers such as Dr. Reddy’s, bolstered by corporate updates from Syngene and Hitachi Energy India. Strong domestic institutional buying of over ₹1,800 crore cushioned the impact of ₹1,100 crore of FII outflows, while blue-chips like Reliance Industries, ICICI Bank and HDFC Bank provided crucial support. Positive global cues—ranging from stable crude oil prices to softer U.S. Treasury yields—lifted risk sentiment, and anticipation of forthcoming GST reform measures added a favorable policy backdrop, encouraging rotation into healthcare, financials and other cyclical plays.
